briefdescription.para: Get a random spawn position for ragdolls.

detaileddescription.para: Generates a random position within the configured spawn volume for ragdoll objects. This helps spread out multiple ragdolls when they are created.

simplesect.para: Random Vector3 position within spawn bounds
Spawn bounds are defined by RAGDOLL_SPAWN_* constants

detaileddescription.para: Creates a complete humanoid ragdoll with articulated joints. The ragdoll is fully physics-simulated and can be used for character physics, death animations, or as a basis for reinforcement learning control.

simplesect.para: Pointer to newly created RagDoll structure
Bodies: 10 (head, torso, 2 upper arms, 2 lower arms, 2 upper legs, 2 lower legs)
All bodies are registered with framework for rendering

detaileddescription.para: Applies motor forces to the ragdoll's joints for control. This is useful for neural network or reinforcement learning control of the ragdoll.

parameterdescription.para: Array of motor force values (one per joint)

simplesect.para: Array should have ragdoll->jointCount elements for hinge joints
For universal joints, uses ragdoll->jointCount * 2 elements
Force of 0 disables the motor for that joint

briefdescription.para: Render a ragdoll to the screen.

detaileddescription.para: Renders all body parts of the ragdoll using the framework's existing rendering system.

simplesect.para: Uses the same drawGeom system as other physics bodies

briefdescription.para: Free a ragdoll and all its resources.

detaileddescription.para: Properly destroys all ODE bodies, geoms, joints, and motors associated with the ragdoll, and frees the wrapper structure.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the ragdoll structure to free

simplesect.para: Removes ragdoll from framework's object list
Frees all allocated memory for bodies, geoms, joints

detaileddescription.para: This file provides a complete ragdoll (humanoid) physics simulation using ODE's joint system. The ragdoll consists of multiple body parts connected by hinge and universal joints, allowing for realistic human-like movement and posing.

sect1.title: Ragdoll Structure
sect1.para:
Body parts (10 total):
Head (sphere)
Torso (box)
Left/Right Upper Arm (capsule)
Left/Right Lower Arm (capsule)
Left/Right Upper Leg (capsule)
Left/Right Lower Leg (capsule)

Joints (9 total):
Neck (hinge)
Left/Right Shoulder (universal)
Left/Right Elbow (hinge)
Left/Right Hip (universal)
Left/Right Knee (hinge)

sect1.title: Motor Control
sect1.para: The ragdoll supports motor control on all joints, making it suitable for neural network or reinforcement learning control. Use UpdateRagdollMotors() to apply forces to joints.
